data.event: Established on 1581 by Gobernador Ronquillo de Peñalosa as "La Villa Rica de Arevalo", named after his hometown Arévalo, Spain, it is one of the first places in the Philippine archipelago to be named in Spanish.

event.title: became the capital of the settlement in the province on 1582

data.event: It became the capital of the settlement in the province on 1582.

event.title: was invaded by the British in 1588

data.event: It was invaded by the British in 1588 and followed by more raids by Moros in 1600 and by the Dutch in 1609, 1614 and 1616.

event.title: followed by more raids by Moros in 1600

data.event: It was invaded by the British in 1588 and followed by more raids by Moros in 1600 and by the Dutch in 1609, 1614 and 1616.

event.title: was incorporated as a district of Iloilo City on July 16, 1937

data.event: It was incorporated as a district of Iloilo City on July 16, 1937.
